Healthy.description: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
preventive_measures: Maintain balanced watering and nutrition.
Inspect crops regularly for early symptoms.
Use disease-free certified seeds.
Ensure proper soil health with organic manure.

Powdery.description: Powdery mildew is a fungal disease appearing as white or gray powdery spots on leaves and stems.
preventive_measures: Avoid overcrowding to improve air circulation.
Spray neem oil or sulfur-based fungicides.
Water plants at the base, not on leaves.
Remove and destroy infected leaves early.

Rust.description: Rust disease causes orange, yellow, or brown pustules on leaves and stems, weakening the plant.
preventive_measures: Avoid overhead irrigation to reduce leaf wetness.
Apply copper or sulfur-based fungicides.
Remove and burn infected leaves.
Practice crop rotation with non-host crops.

Leaf Blight.description: Leaf blight causes brown or black streaks and spots on leaves, leading to premature drying.
preventive_measures: Use resistant crop varieties.
Spray mancozeb or copper oxychloride fungicides.
Avoid excessive nitrogen fertilizers.
Destroy crop residues after harvest.

Leaf Spot.description: Leaf spot diseases cause small, circular dark spots on leaves which may merge and kill leaf tissue.
preventive_measures: Ensure proper plant spacing for ventilation.
Apply fungicides like chlorothalonil or mancozeb.
Remove diseased plant debris promptly.
Rotate crops to break the disease cycle.

Mosaic Virus.description: Mosaic virus causes mottled, yellow-green patches on leaves and stunted plant growth.
preventive_measures: Use virus-free seeds and seedlings.
Control insect vectors like aphids and whiteflies.
Remove and destroy infected plants immediately.
Plant resistant crop varieties when available.

Bacterial Wilt.description: Bacterial wilt causes sudden wilting and yellowing of plants, often leading to plant death.
preventive_measures: Use resistant crop varieties.
Ensure proper soil drainage to prevent waterlogging.
Apply crop rotation with cereals and non-susceptible crops.
Disinfect tools to avoid spreading bacteria.

Downy Mildew.description: Downy mildew appears as yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces with grayish mold underneath.
preventive_measures: Improve field drainage and reduce humidity.
Spray fungicides like metalaxyl or fosetyl-Al.
Avoid excessive irrigation.
Plant resistant varieties where possible.
